origination.corpname: Michigan Citizens for Humphrey and Muskie.

did.unittitle:
Michigan Citizens for Humphrey and Muskie records
1968
did.abstract: Political organization supporting the Democratic ticket for President in 1968. Correspondence and financial records concerning the campaign; also papers and photographs concerning the pre-convention campaign for the nomination of Hubert Humphrey for President.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The record group was received from Congressman James Oâ€™Hara (donor no. 5939).

accruals.p: No further additions to the records are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The record group is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Michigan Citizens for Humphrey and Muskie records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: The organization was established in the summer of 1968 to support the candidacy of Hubert Humphrey for Democratic nomination for President of the United States. The organization was originally named Michigan Citizens for Humphrey. With Humphrey's nomination, the organization became Michigan Citizens for Humphrey and Muskie.

scopecontent.p: The record group consists of correspondence, memoranda, organizational papers, a financial report, and delegate material from the Democratic National Convention. There is, in addition, a folder of campaign photos and a reel-to-reel tape of a campaign message.
